access.notes: Registered URL redirects via WordPress Redirection plugin to /ehi-export/. All content present in HTML source. Tabbed interface uses Stackable blocks but doesn't require JS to access content.

export_format.description: ConnectEHR exports patient data as HL7 C-CDA 2.1 Standard XML via batch export. CQMsolution exports patient-level data as QRDA I XML files (zipped). These are two separate products with different export mechanisms.

documentation.notes: Documentation is entirely inline HTML with screenshots. No data dictionary, field listing, schema, or downloadable documentation artifacts. Only process/workflow instructions for generating exports.

clinical.evidence: ConnectEHR exports C-CDA 2.1 XML which includes standard clinical data (problems, medications, allergies, labs, etc. per CDA template). CQMsolution exports QRDA I which contains quality measure patient-level data including clinical observations.

secure_messages.evidence: No mention of messages, inbox, communication, or secure messaging in any export documentation. Patient Portal is listed as a separate product but not referenced in EHI export.

billing_financial.evidence: No mention of billing, charges, claims, payments, CPT codes, or financial data in export documentation.

insurance_coverage.evidence: No mention of insurance, coverage, eligibility, authorization, payer, or carrier data in export documentation.

appointments_scheduling.evidence: No mention of appointments, scheduling, encounters, or visits in export documentation.

documents_images.evidence: Overview tab discusses FHIR DocumentReference supporting CDA documents, PDFs, scanned paper, faxes, clinical notes, images (JPEG, GIF, TIFF), and non-standard formats. ConnectEHR C-CDA export would include document references. However, this appears to be aspirational — currently only CCD is supported in DocumentReference.

audit_trails.evidence: No mention of audit trails, access logs, or tracking in export documentation.

issues: No data dictionary or field-level documentation — only workflow/process instructions for generating exports
No schema definition (DDL, JSON Schema, XSD) or structural documentation of what fields the export contains
Export relies on standard formats (C-CDA 2.1, QRDA I) rather than custom format, so HL7 specifications serve as implicit schema documentation

CQMsolution's claim that 'QRDA I output XML contains all EHI' is questionable — QRDA I is a quality reporting format, not a general-purpose EHI container. It contains clinical observations relevant to quality measures, not billing, scheduling, messaging, or administrative data
ConnectEHR C-CDA export covers standard clinical domains but C-CDA does not include billing, insurance details, secure messages, audit trails, or custom data
No sample export files or test data provided
Overview tab discusses FHIR DocumentReference expansion beyond CCD as aspirational ('preparing to expand') rather than current capability
Documentation does not address how 'all EHI' including non-clinical data domains (billing, scheduling, messaging) would be exported
summary: Dynamic Health IT provides a single HTML page documenting EHI export for two products. ConnectEHR exports patient data as C-CDA 2.1 XML via a batch admin interface (7-step UI walkthrough with screenshots). CQMsolution exports QRDA I XML files containing patient-level quality measure data. The documentation is process-oriented (how to run the export) rather than content-oriented (what data is exported). No data dictionary, field listing, or schema is provided — the vendor relies on the C-CDA and QRDA I standards as implicit format documentation. Notably absent is any documentation of how non-clinical data domains (billing, insurance, secure messages, appointments, audit trails) would be included in an 'all EHI' export, raising questions about completeness.
